article:
The 'melanocortins' are a group of peptide hormones which include
adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH) and the different forms of melanocyte-
stimulating hormone (MSH). They can be synthetic (created in a lab).
In humans they can be endogenously produced from proopiomelanocortin (POMC) in
the pituitary gland. The melanocortins exert their effects by binding
to and activating the melanocortin receptors.
